summary:
Extensive experience in police management, security at international airports, international relations and the realization of change in organizations. People manager greatly in achieving set new goals, especially when it comes to other practices in changing organizations, particularly at the interface of public and private interests. Much knowledge of innovative border control technology and procedures, intelligence-led policing, security civil aviation, and crisis management. My strong points are my professional attitude, critical analyses of situations and developments, a sincere interest in people, a sense of human relations, a result-oriented approach, perseverance, an eye for structure in difficult situations, diplomacy with a business edge and the ability to empathise in political issues. I am also a good negotiator.

Specialties: At the core of my development is my openness to new initiatives. I find it essential to keep investing in myself. I stand for integrity and involvement in the organisation. I endeavour to maintain an even balance between my working life and my private life. 
I wish to be myself in all circumstances. By giving people a central position in both my working and private lives, I am increasingly reaping the rewards in the things that I do.

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the execution of all Royal Netherlands Marechaussee tasks at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. Schiphol Airport is one of the largest airports in Europe with over 45 million passengers passing through it per year. It plays an important role in the Netherlands’ economy. Security is an essential aspect of airport operations. The complexity of the airport and the special attention it receives in politics and from the media require decisive action at the airport. The Royal Netherlands Marechaussee is responsible for police and security tasks, border control, the deportation of illegal immigrants, criminal investigations and supervision of civilian aviation security. The Identity and Document Fraud Centre of Expertise and the Airports Centre of Expertise are also part of the organisation. As Commander, I am responsible for leading and managing almost 2,000 members of personnel. Schiphol district makes an important contribution to innovation in the areas of border management, information-driven operations and leadership. I was responsible for dealing with the Turkish Airlines crash on 25 February 2009.
profile_positions.title: Commander Royal Marechaussee at Schiphol Airport

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for policy development and advising the Chief of Defence on all aspects of international military cooperation. This involved subjects related to organisations such as NATO, EU, UN and OSCE, as well as bilateral cooperation with other countries.  
Responsible for managing the Netherlands’ military attachés abroad as well as being the point of contact for foreign attachés posted in the Netherlands. After the restructuring of the Defence Staff in 2004, oversaw the establishment of the International Military Cooperation Branch and the formulation and implementation of defence policy in this field.  
I was closely involved in the administrative preparation of the government’s decision-making process regarding the possible participation of the Netherlands Defence organisation in Afghanistan for the period after August 2008.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Chief of Staff for International Military Cooperation

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the execution of all day-to-day Royal Netherlands Marechaussee police tasks in these two provinces. More specifically: the police tasks at Rotterdam Airport, the security of members of the Royal Family, maritime border control and cross-border criminal investigation. 
Responsible for Royal Netherlands Marechaussee security and police tasks during the interments of HRH Prince Claus and HRH Princess Juliana. Supervised the security at the Royal residence “Eikenhorst” in cooperation with the Royal Household Service and the Netherlands Government Buildings Agency. 
Responsible for setting up the “Communication and Leadership” project aimed at improving operational management and the effectiveness of leadership. This initiative was later promoted to a broader platform, i.e. the 2010 Royal Netherlands Marechaussee policy plan on, among other things, entrepreneurial leadership.
profile_positions.title: Commander District Zuid Holland and Zeeland

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Royal Netherlands Marechausee’s corporate planning. This mainly involved long-term plans over several years, drawn up in coordination with the manager and relevant authorities. For the first time, this was done by using the so-called annual “Justice letter” as reference. A start was also made with the introduction of so-called top-level reports as control elements on the execution of tasks. 
Led the “Authority and Management” project in cooperation with (retired) Chief Commissioner of Police Jan Siepel. The project focused on creating a more structured method for authorities and the manager for decision-making in the so-called Royal Netherlands Marechaussee Central Council. After its establishment, acted as policy adviser and secretary of the council. 
A start was made with structural consultations with representatives of Amsterdam Airport Schiphol regarding the planned development of Royal Netherlands Marechaussee tasks at the airport.
profile_positions.title: Head of the Operational Policy Preparation Division

profile_positions.description: Initially a member of a shift team, shortly thereafter, as deputy head of the operation centre, closely involved in the preparation and deployment of military units, mainly to missions in the Balkans (Bosnia Herzegovina and Kosovo). Police operations, such as UNIPTF, received special attention.
profile_positions.title: Defence Crisis Management Centre

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee’s emergency incident regulations at Schiphol Airport. As a project officer, responsible for the reorganisation of the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee at the airport. An external advice bureau (AE&F) also participated in this project. A thorough analysis of organisational processes resulted in a new structure and new working methods. Consultation with the employee representation committee and personnel led to a more efficient and effective execution of tasks. Moreover, discussions with the airport authorities regarding the planning and execution of police tasks were formalised.
profile_positions.title: Head of the Operational Service, Schiphol District

profile_positions.description: Substantiating the modernisation of Defence personnel policy, more specifically that of the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee. Consultations with the Federation of Public Service Unions played a central role in the process.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Head of the Personnel and Management Development Division

profile_positions.description: Deployment to Stabilisation Force Iraq in support of the provincial Chief of Police during the restructuring of his organisation. As a member of the Coalition Provisional Authority staff in Al Muthanna also responsible for policy advice in the area of public order enforcement. In this context, much consultation took place with the Iraqi governor and the provincial council regarding the administrative embedding of police activities
profile_positions.title: Mentor to the Chief of Police of Al Muthanna in Iraq
